wikipedia_page.main: Brigadier General Charles Bulkeley Bulkeley-Johnson (1867 –1917) was a British and Egyptian Army officer who served in the Mahdist War and the First World War, he was killed in action on 11 April 1917, while commanding the 8th Cavalry Brigade, on the second day of the Battle of Arras.He is one of the only foreigners to receive the Russian Imperial Order of St. George Cross, the highest military order, in both IVth and IIIrd class, for his bravery.

link_mentions.page: British Cavalry Corps order of battle 1914

response: Bulkeley Street in Hung Hom was named after him. His son, Charles Bulkeley Bulkeley-Johnson was a highly decorated British cavalry general who died in the First World War.
*Charles Bulkeley Bulkeley-Johnson (1867–1917), British Army brigadier general
